qas.question: Which Japanese Admiral felt it was necessary to go to war with the U.S.?
Why was the Dutch East Indies important to Japan?
In what year did the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere expand?
What was the importance of the Dutch East Indies to Japan?
Who said a showdown between Japan and the United States would be necessary?
By what year did Japanese strategists expand their concept of the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere?

context: From as early as 1935 Japanese military strategists had concluded the Dutch East Indies were, because of their <a1_0><a3_0>oil reserves<a3_0/><a1_0/>, of considerable importance to Japan. By <a2_0><a5_0>1940<a5_0/><a2_0/> they had expanded this to include Indo-China, Malaya, and the Philippines within their concept of the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere. Japanese troop build ups in Hainan, Taiwan, and Haiphong were noted, Japanese Army officers were openly talking about an inevitable war, and <a4_0>Admiral <a0_0>Sankichi Takahashi<a4_0/><a0_0/> was reported as saying a showdown with the United States was necessary.
